meanings.definition: A large bundle of paper, hay, cotton, etc., tightly bound with cords or straps.
meanings.sent1: The farmer loaded a heavy bale of hay onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck carried several bales of paper to the printing press.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought the bale of cotton was a giant pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the barn as she tried to lift the bale of hay.
meanings.sent5: The bale of paper stood out in the warehouse, waiting to be shipped.

meanings.sent1: The workers baled the freshly cut hay in the field.

meanings.sent4: He baled up memories of his childhood to keep them safe.
meanings.sent5: The farmer baled the harvested wheat under the clear sky.
